question_text: How does RAID 1 maintain data availability if one drive fails?
answer_options: It rebuilds the drive using parity data
It switches to a solid-state backup
It automatically mirrors the drive to the cloud
It continues using the mirrored copy on the other drive
correct_answer: It continues using the mirrored copy on the other drive
explanation: RAID 1 creates an exact duplicate of all data, so the system can operate using the remaining mirrored drive if one fails.
